boardgame.name: Gloom
晦暗世界
boardgame.description: The world of Gloom is a sad and benighted place. The sky is gray, the tea is cold, and a new tragedy lies around every corner. Debt, disease, heartache, and packs of rabid flesh-eating mice_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;just when it seems like things can't get any worse, they do. But some say that one's reward in the afterlife is based on the misery endured in life. If so, there may yet be hope_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;mdash;if not in this world, then in the peace that lies beyond._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the Gloom card game, you assume control of the fate of an eccentric family of misfits and misanthropes. The goal of the game is sad, but simple: you want your characters to suffer the greatest tragedies possible before passing on to the well-deserved respite of death. You'll play horrible mishaps like Pursued by Poodles or Mocked by Midgets on your own characters to lower their Self-Worth scores, while trying to cheer your opponents' characters with marriages and other happy occasions that pile on positive points. The player with the lowest total Family Value wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Printed on transparent plastic cards, Gloom features an innovative design by noted RPG author Keith Baker. Multiple modifier cards can be played on top of the same character card; since the cards are transparent, elements from previously played modifier cards either show through or are obscured by those played above them. You'll immediately and easily know the worth of every character, no matter how many modifiers they have. You've got to see (through) this game to believe it!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each of the three expansions for Gloom adds one more player, thus with all three expansions, this should be playable with seven players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Game is brand new with publisher shrink-wrap. Save 30% or more off of every item we have listed on Boardgamegeek.com! Items are shipped within one or two business days upon reciept of payment (remember, money order, cashier_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s check or cash at your own risk!) If you do not wish to send payment and would rather pay us directly, you can give us a call at 816.554.7333 (Tuesday through Saturday) using Visa, Mastercard and American Express or by contacting us in order to make a Paypal payment (a 4.5% surcharge will be added to the total payment.) Shipping is based off of weight so it completely depends on the game(s) themselves though the average is $7 - $9.00 throughout the Continental US (and yes, we will combine on shipping!!!). If you need a specific type of shipping - such as Overnight or with Insurance - or have any questions, drop us an email. MO orders pay 7.35% sales tax. Also be sure to be on the lookout for PREORDER games being listed for the upcoming months! For more info about the store visit www.pfcomics.com (be sure to check out our forums for our weekly and monthly events).

Brand New!! Still in shrinkwrap. Will ship internationally. Atlas Games (ATG 1250)

Atlas Games (ATG 1250) Gloom: The Game of Inauspicious Incidents and Grave Consequences The world of Gloom is a sad and benighted place. The sky is gray, the tea is cold, and a new tragedy lies around every corner. Debt, disease, heartache, and packs of rabid flesh-eating mice -- just when it seems like things can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t get any worse, they do. But some say that one_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s reward in the afterlife is based on the misery endured in life. If so, there may yet be hope -- if not in this world, then in the peace that lies beyond. In the Gloom card game, you assume control of the fate of an eccentric family of misfits and misanthropes. The goal of the game is sad, but simple: you want your characters to suffer the greatest tragedies possible before passing on to the well-deserved respite of death. You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll play horrible mishaps like Pursued by Poodles or Mocked by Midgets on your own characters to lower their Self-Worth scores, while trying to cheer your opponents_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; characters with marriages and other happy occasions that pile on positive points. The player with the lowest total Family Value wins. Printed on transparent plastic cards, Gloom features an innovative design by noted RPG author Keith Baker. Multiple modifier cards can be played on top of the same character card; since the cards are transparent, elements from previously played modifier cards either show through or are obscured by those played above them. You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll immediately and easily know the worth of every character, no matter how many modifiers they have. You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve got to see (through) this game to believe it! For 2 to 4 players, ages 8 and up.
Only played once.

This game is in excellent condition. The cards are mint, but the seal on the box has come loose. I can recommend getting a card box for this set, as they fit perfectly and it’s much better storage than the factory box. I’m also selling the Unhappy Homes expansion as well, so please check it out! Shipping within the USA will be $3.99, and if you buy the expansion as well I’ll ship together to save on shipping costs. Please contact me for international shipping. Many thanks for your business!
Cards are in plastic box with rules (original box is not with us anymore.)

Opened, but not played. Cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; original condition is scuffed, but playable. Includes Unhappy Homes expansion, also originally sold scuffed, but playable. S_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;H is dependent on buyer_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s location and preferred method of delivery.
Very good, complete. First edition, printed in India. $5 shipping in U.S.; $9 to Canada.

*Includes base game plus Unwelcome Guests expansion* The listed price is to buy both games. (I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve listed the pair under both the base game and the expansion.) The box to the base game is in good condition, with wear at the joints. The box for Unwelcome Guests is in very good condition. The cards and rulebook are in good condition. If you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d like, I can send you an extra copy of half of the cards from the base game. However, these extra cards are blurry, so I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t really recommend them. (I bought the first printing of the game, and Atlas sent me a legible replacement for the one deck which was misprinted.) Shipping charge will be an estimate of the actual cost of shipping the game to you. That means I can usually reduce shipping charges if you buy more than one of my games -- Send me a message and I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll calculate the discount.

Atlas Games (ATG1250) The Game of Inauspicious Incidents and Grave Consequences! The world of Gloom is a sad and benighted place. The sky is gray, the tea is cold, and a new tragedy lies around every corner. Debt, disease, heartache, and packs of rabid flesh-eating mice -- just when it seems like things can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t get any worse, they do. But some say that one_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s reward in the afterlife is based on the misery endured in life. If so, there may yet be hope -- if not in this world, then in the peace that lies beyond. In the Gloom card game, you assume control of the fate of an eccentric family of misfits and misanthropes. The goal of the game is sad, but simple: you want your characters to suffer the greatest tragedies possible before passing on to the well-deserved respite of death. You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll play horrible mishaps like Pursued by Poodles or Mocked by Midgets on your own characters to lower their Self-Worth scores, while trying to cheer your opponents_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; characters with marriages and other happy occasions that pile on positive points. The player with the lowest total Family Value wins. Printed on transparent plastic cards, Gloom features an innovative design by noted RPG author Keith Baker. Multiple modifier cards can be played on top of the same character card; since the cards are transparent, elements from previously played modifier cards either show through or are obscured by those played above them. You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll immediately and easily know the worth of every character, no matter how many modifiers they have. You_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve got to see (through) this game to believe it!
Played a couple of times. UK Shipping £3
Also included are Gloom: Unhappy Homes, Munchkin Impossible and Ingenious: Travel Edition. Reserved for tazz
